DOC.brief_summary: Aim study define CT-based `` tissue window '' stroke thrombolysis . Our primary hypothesis 1. patient `` tissue window '' ( favourable non-contrast CT ( NCCT ) scan intracranial occlusion CT angiography ( CTA ) perfusion-CT-mismatch '' ( area reduce cerebral blood flow ( CBF ) > area reduce cerebral blood volume ( CBV ) ) represent significant proportion ( > 20 % ) acute stroke patient therefore important target group future interventional study 2. patient `` tissue window '' suffer unfavourable outcome ( > 50 % mRS = > 4 3 month ) occlude artery recanalized .
DOC.brief_title: CT Based Definition Tissue Window Acute Stroke Thrombolysis
DOC.criteria: ischemic anterior circulation stroke last see normal < 12 hour stroke severity = > 3 National Institute Health Stroke Scale multimodal CT stroke protocol perform informed consent obtain premorbid modify Rankin Scale score > 3 contraindication contrast medium application pregnancy breast feed subacute stroke > 50 % MCA territory CT evidence nonvascular cause stroke symptom
